sinaiticus.text: But they continued their journey from Perga and came to Antioch of Pisidia; and having entered the synagogue on the sabbath day, they sat down.

verses.text: But they continued their journey from Perga and came to Antioch of Pisidia; and having entered the synagogue on the sabbath day, they sat down.

sinaiticus.text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them saying: Men, brethren, if there is in you any word of exhortation for the people, speak.

verses.text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them saying: Men, brethren, if there is in you any word of exhortation for the people, speak.

sinaiticus.text: And Paul arose, and, beckoning with Ills hand, said: Men of Israel

verses.text: And Paul arose, and, beckoning with Ills hand, said: Men of Israel

sinaiticus.text: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and the people he exalted during the sojourn in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm brought he them out of it;

verses.text: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and the people he exalted during the sojourn in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm brought he them out of it;

sinaiticus.text: and for a time of about forty years he nourished them in the wilderness;

verses.text: and for a time of about forty years he nourished them in the wilderness;

sinaiticus.text: and after he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he divided to them their land for an inheritance,

verses.text: and after he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he divided to them their land for an inheritance,

sinaiticus.text: for about four hundred and fifty years. And after this he gave judges till Samuel the prophet,

verses.text: for about four hundred and fifty years. And after this he gave judges till Samuel the prophet,

sinaiticus.text: And after that they asked for a king; and God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, forty years;

verses.text: And after that they asked for a king; and God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, forty years;

sinaiticus.text: and he removed him and raised up for them David as a king; to whom he also gave testimony: I have found David the son of Jesse, a man according to my heart, who shall do all my will.

verses.text: and he removed him and raised up for them David as a king; to whom he also gave testimony: I have found David the son of Jesse, a man according to my heart, who shall do all my will.

sinaiticus.text: From this man’s posterity, God, according to promise, has brought to Israel a Saviour, Jesus,

verses.text: From this man’s posterity, God, according to promise, has brought to Israel a Saviour, Jesus,

sinaiticus.text: John having preached, before his entrance, the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

verses.text: John having preached, before his entrance, the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

sinaiticus.text: But as John was fulfilling his course, he said: Who do you suppose that I am? I am not he: but behold, there comes after me one, the sandal of whose feet I am not worthy to loose.

verses.text: But as John was fulfilling his course, he said: Who do you suppose that I am? I am not he: but behold, there comes after me one, the sandal of whose feet I am not worthy to loose.

sinaiticus.text: Men, brethren, sons of the race of Abraham, and those among you that fear God, to us is the word of this salvation sent.

verses.text: Men, brethren, sons of the race of Abraham, and those among you that fear God, to us is the word of this salvation sent.

sinaiticus.text: For they that dwell in Jerusalem and their rulers, being ignorant of this one, and of the voices of the prophets that are read every sabbath, have fulfilled them in condemning him;

verses.text: For they that dwell in Jerusalem and their rulers, being ignorant of this one, and of the voices of the prophets that are read every sabbath, have fulfilled them in condemning him;

sinaiticus.text: and though they found no cause of death, they asked of Pilate that he might be put to death.

verses.text: and though they found no cause of death, they asked of Pilate that he might be put to death.

sinaiticus.text: And when they had fulfilled all things that are written concerning him, they took him down from the tree and laid him in a sepulcher.

verses.text: And when they had fulfilled all things that are written concerning him, they took him down from the tree and laid him in a sepulcher.

sinaiticus.text: But God raised him from the dead;

verses.text: But God raised him from the dead;

sinaiticus.text: and he appeared for many days to those that went up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem: who now are his witnesses to the people.

verses.text: and he appeared for many days to those that went up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem: who now are his witnesses to the people.

sinaiticus.text: And we announce to you glad tidings of the promise made to the fathers, that God has fulfilled this to our children by raising up Jesus,

verses.text: And we announce to you glad tidings of the promise made to the fathers, that God has fulfilled this to our children by raising up Jesus,

sinaiticus.text: as it is also written in the second Psalm: Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

verses.text: as it is also written in the second Psalm: Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

sinaiticus.text: But that he raised him from the dead no more to return to corruption, he has thus spoken: I will give you the faithful, holy things of David.

verses.text: But that he raised him from the dead no more to return to corruption, he has thus spoken: I will give you the faithful, holy things of David.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore he says also in another Psalm: Thou wilt not suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.236

verses.text: Wherefore he says also in another Psalm: Thou wilt not suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.236

sinaiticus.text: For David indeed, having served his own generation by the counsel of God, fell asleep and was laid with his fathers and saw corruption;

verses.text: For David indeed, having served his own generation by the counsel of God, fell asleep and was laid with his fathers and saw corruption;

sinaiticus.text: but he whom God raised up saw no corruption.

verses.text: but he whom God raised up saw no corruption.

sinaiticus.text: Be it known to you, therefore, men, brethren, that through this man is preached to you remission of sins:

verses.text: Be it known to you, therefore, men, brethren, that through this man is preached to you remission of sins:

sinaiticus.text: in this one, every one that believes is justified from all things, from which you could not be justified in the law of Moses.

verses.text: in this one, every one that believes is justified from all things, from which you could not be justified in the law of Moses.

sinaiticus.text: Take heed, therefore, lest there come upon you that which is said in the prophets:

verses.text: Take heed, therefore, lest there come upon you that which is said in the prophets:

sinaiticus.text: Behold, you despisers, and wonder, and perish, for I work a work in your days, a work which you would not believe, though any one plainly declare it to you.

verses.text: Behold, you despisers, and wonder, and perish, for I work a work in your days, a work which you would not believe, though any one plainly declare it to you.

sinaiticus.text: But when they had gone out they besought that these words might be spoken to them on the next sabbath.

verses.text: But when they had gone out they besought that these words might be spoken to them on the next sabbath.

sinaiticus.text: And when the synagogue was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.

verses.text: And when the synagogue was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.

sinaiticus.text: And on the next sabbath almost all the city came together to hear the word of the Lord.

verses.text: And on the next sabbath almost all the city came together to hear the word of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: But the Jews. seeing the multitudes, were filled with envy, and spoke against the things spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.

verses.text: But the Jews. seeing the multitudes, were filled with envy, and spoke against the things spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming.

sinaiticus.text: And Paul and Barnabas, speaking boldly, said: To you was it needful that the word of God should first be spoken; but since you thrust it from you and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.

verses.text: And Paul and Barnabas, speaking boldly, said: To you was it needful that the word of God should first be spoken; but since you thrust it from you and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.

sinaiticus.text: For so has the Lord commanded us: I have set thee as a light for the Gentiles, that thou shouldst be for salvation to the end of the earth.

verses.text: For so has the Lord commanded us: I have set thee as a light for the Gentiles, that thou shouldst be for salvation to the end of the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And hearing it, the Gentiles rejoiced, and glorified the word of the Lord, and as many as had been ordered for eternal life believed;

verses.text: And hearing it, the Gentiles rejoiced, and glorified the word of the Lord, and as many as had been ordered for eternal life believed;

sinaiticus.text: and the word of the Lord was carried throughout the whole country.

verses.text: and the word of the Lord was carried throughout the whole country.

sinaiticus.text: But the Jews excited the devout women that were honorable, and the chief men of the city, and raised a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out from their borders.

verses.text: But the Jews excited the devout women that were honorable, and the chief men of the city, and raised a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them out from their borders.

sinaiticus.text: But having shaken off the dust from their feet against them, they came to Iconium;

verses.text: But having shaken off the dust from their feet against them, they came to Iconium;

sinaiticus.text: and the disciples were filled with joy and the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: and the disciples were filled with joy and the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass in Iconium that they went together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spoke that a great multitude of Jews and also of Greeks believed.

verses.text: And it came to pass in Iconium that they went together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spoke that a great multitude of Jews and also of Greeks believed.

sinaiticus.text: But the Jews that believed not excited and imbittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brethren.

verses.text: But the Jews that believed not excited and imbittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brethren.

sinaiticus.text: A long time therefore spent they speaking, boldly in the Lord, who gave testimony to the word of his grace by giving signs and wonders to be done through their hands.

verses.text: A long time therefore spent they speaking, boldly in the Lord, who gave testimony to the word of his grace by giving signs and wonders to be done through their hands.

sinaiticus.text: But the multitude of the city was divided, and some were with the Jews and some with the apostles.

verses.text: But the multitude of the city was divided, and some were with the Jews and some with the apostles.

sinaiticus.text: But when there was a violent intent of the Gentiles and also of the Jews with their rulers, to outrage and to stone them,

verses.text: But when there was a violent intent of the Gentiles and also of the Jews with their rulers, to outrage and to stone them,

verses.text: being aware of it, they fled to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and the neighboring regions;

sinaiticus.text: and there they preached the gospel.

verses.text: and there they preached the gospel.

sinaiticus.text: And a man in Lystra, without strength in his feet, sat, lame from his mother’s womb: who had never walked.

verses.text: And a man in Lystra, without strength in his feet, sat, lame from his mother’s womb: who had never walked.

sinaiticus.text: This man heard Paul speak, who, looking earnestly on him, and seeing that he had faith to be saved,

verses.text: This man heard Paul speak, who, looking earnestly on him, and seeing that he had faith to be saved,

sinaiticus.text: said with a loud voice: Stand erect on thy feet. And he leaped up and walked.

verses.text: said with a loud voice: Stand erect on thy feet. And he leaped up and walked.

verses.text: And the multitudes, seeing what Paul had done, lifted up their voice, saying in the Lycaonian language: The gods in the likeness of men have come down to us;

sinaiticus.text: and they called Barnabas, Zeus; and Paul, Hermes; because he was the chief speaker.

verses.text: and they called Barnabas, Zeus; and Paul, Hermes; because he was the chief speaker.

verses.text: And the priest of Zeus, who was before the city, having brought bulls and garlands to the gates, intended to offer sacrifice with the multitudes.

verses.text: and saying: Men, why do these things? We also of like passions with yourselves are men, preaching the gospel that you turn from these vanities to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all things that are in them;

verses.text: though, indeed, he left himself not without testimony in doing good, giving you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and gladness.

sinaiticus.text: However, as the disciples stood about him, he rose up and came into the city. And on the next day he went forth with Barnabas to Derbe.

verses.text: strengthening the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to abide in the faith, and saying that through many afflictions we must enter into the kingdom of God.

sinaiticus.text: But after they had arrived and brought the church together, they related what things God had done with them, and that he had opened to the Gentiles the door of faith.

verses.text: But after Paul and Barnabas had had no little dissension and discussion with them, they arranged that Paul and Barnabas and some others of them should go up to the apostles and elders at Jerusalem concerning this question.

verses.text: They therefore, having been conducted on their journey by the church, passed through Phenice and Samaria, relating the conversion of the Gentiles; and they caused great joy to all the brethren.

verses.text: But when they had arrived at Jerusalem they were received by the church and the apostles and the elders: they also announced what things God had done with them.

verses.text: and made no distinction between us and them, having purified their hearts by faith.

sinaiticus.text: I persecuted this way even to death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

verses.text: I persecuted this way even to death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

sinaiticus.text: as the chief priest, also, will testify for me, and all the presbytery; from whom also having received letters to the brethren. I was journeying to Damascus, to bring those that were there also bound to Jerusalem, that they might be punished.

sinaiticus.text: But it came to pass as I was journeying and drawing near to Damascus about midday, suddenly there flashed around me a great light from heaven,

sinaiticus.text: and I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

verses.text: and I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

sinaiticus.text: But I answered: Who art thou, Lord? And he said to me: I am Jesus the Nazarene, whom thou persecutest.

verses.text: But I answered: Who art thou, Lord? And he said to me: I am Jesus the Nazarene, whom thou persecutest.

sinaiticus.text: And those that were with me saw indeed the light, but understood not the voice of him that spoke to me.

verses.text: And those that were with me saw indeed the light, but understood not the voice of him that spoke to me.

sinaiticus.text: But I said: What shall I do. Lord? And the Lord said to me; Arise, and go into Damascus, and there it shall be told thee of all things which it has been appointed thee to do.

verses.text: But I said: What shall I do. Lord? And the Lord said to me; Arise, and go into Damascus, and there it shall be told thee of all things which it has been appointed thee to do.

sinaiticus.text: But when I did not see on account of the glory of that light, being led by the hand by those that were with me, I came into Damascus.254

verses.text: But when I did not see on account of the glory of that light, being led by the hand by those that were with me, I came into Damascus.254

sinaiticus.text: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews that dwelt there,

verses.text: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews that dwelt there,

sinaiticus.text: came to me and stood, by and said to me: Brother Saul, receive sight. And in the same hour I looked upon him.

verses.text: came to me and stood, by and said to me: Brother Saul, receive sight. And in the same hour I looked upon him.

sinaiticus.text: And he said: The God of our fathers has chosen thee to know his will and to see the Just One, and to hear a voice from his mouth,

verses.text: And he said: The God of our fathers has chosen thee to know his will and to see the Just One, and to hear a voice from his mouth,

verses.text: because thou shalt be for him a witness to all men of what thou hast seen and heard.

sinaiticus.text: And now why delayest thou? Arise and be baptized and wash away thy sins, calling on his name.

verses.text: And now why delayest thou? Arise and be baptized and wash away thy sins, calling on his name.

sinaiticus.text: and saw him saying to me: Hasten and go quickly out of Jerusalem, for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.

verses.text: and saw him saying to me: Hasten and go quickly out of Jerusalem, for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to me: Go, for I will send thee far off to the Gentiles.

sinaiticus.text: But as they stretched him forward for the scourge, Paul said to the centurion that stood by: Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?

verses.text: But as they stretched him forward for the scourge, Paul said to the centurion that stood by: Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?

sinaiticus.text: And the centurion, hearing it, came and reported to the officer, saying: What art thou about to do? for this man is a Roman.

verses.text: And the centurion, hearing it, came and reported to the officer, saying: What art thou about to do? for this man is a Roman.

sinaiticus.text: But the officer came and said to him: Tell me, art thou a Roman? And he said: Yes.

verses.text: But the officer came and said to him: Tell me, art thou a Roman? And he said: Yes.

sinaiticus.text: The officer answered: I purchased this citizenship at a great price. But Paul said: I, however, was born so.

verses.text: The officer answered: I purchased this citizenship at a great price. But Paul said: I, however, was born so.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore they that were about to examine him immediately departed from him; and the officer also was afraid, having learned that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.

verses.text: Therefore they that were about to examine him immediately departed from him; and the officer also was afraid, having learned that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.

sinaiticus.text: But on the morrow, wishing to know the certainty of that of which he was accused by the Jews, he loosed him and commanded the chief priests and all the Sanhedrim to assemble, and brought Paul down

sinaiticus.text: But Paul, looking earnestly on the Sanhedrim, said: Men, brethren, with all good conscience have I lived to God till this day.

verses.text: But Paul, looking earnestly on the Sanhedrim, said: Men, brethren, with all good conscience have I lived to God till this day.

verses.text: And the chief priest Ananias commanded those that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.

sinaiticus.text: Then Paul said to him: God will smite thee, whited wall; and sittest thou to judge me: according to the law, and in violation of law commandest thou me; to be smitten?

verses.text: Then Paul said to him: God will smite thee, whited wall; and sittest thou to judge me: according to the law, and in violation of law commandest thou me; to be smitten?

sinaiticus.text: But those that stood by said: Revilest thou God’s chief priest?

verses.text: But those that stood by said: Revilest thou God’s chief priest?

sinaiticus.text: And Paul replied: I knew not, brethren, that he was chief priest; for it is written: Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.

verses.text: And Paul replied: I knew not, brethren, that he was chief priest; for it is written: Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.

sinaiticus.text: But Paul, knowing that the one part belonged to the Sadducees and the other to the Pharisees, cried out in the Sanhedrim: Men, brethren, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees: concerning the hope and the resurrection of the dead am I judged.

verses.text: But Paul, knowing that the one part belonged to the Sadducees and the other to the Pharisees, cried out in the Sanhedrim: Men, brethren, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees: concerning the hope and the resurrection of the dead am I judged.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had said this, there arose a dissension of the Pharisees and the Sadducees, and the multitude was divided.

verses.text: And when he had said this, there arose a dissension of the Pharisees and the Sadducees, and the multitude was divided.

sinaiticus.text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess both.

verses.text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, neither angel nor spirit; but the Pharisees confess both.

sinaiticus.text: And there arose a great cry; and some of the scribes of the part of the Pharisees arose and contended, saying: We find no fault in this man; but what if a spirit has spoken to him, or an angel?

verses.text: And there arose a great cry; and some of the scribes of the part of the Pharisees arose and contended, saying: We find no fault in this man; but what if a spirit has spoken to him, or an angel?

sinaiticus.text: But as there arose much dissension, the officer, fearing lest Paul might be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from the midst of them and lead him into the fortress

verses.text: But as there arose much dissension, the officer, fearing lest Paul might be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from the midst of them and lead him into the fortress

sinaiticus.text: But on the following night the Lord stood by him and said: Take courage: for as thou hast testified concerning me in Jerusalem, so must thou testify also in Rome.

verses.text: But on the following night the Lord stood by him and said: Take courage: for as thou hast testified concerning me in Jerusalem, so must thou testify also in Rome.

sinaiticus.text: Now therefore do you with the Sanhedrim make known to the officer that he may bring him down to you, as if you would inquire more particularly into his case; but we are ready to kill him before he shall have come near.

verses.text: Now therefore do you with the Sanhedrim make known to the officer that he may bring him down to you, as if you would inquire more particularly into his case; but we are ready to kill him before he shall have come near.

verses.text: And Paul called to him one of the centurions and said: Conduct this young man to the officer, for he has something to tell him.256

sinaiticus.text: He then took him and brought him to the officer and said: The prisoner Paul called me to him and requested me to conduct this young man to thee, as he has something to tell thee.

verses.text: He then took him and brought him to the officer and said: The prisoner Paul called me to him and requested me to conduct this young man to thee, as he has something to tell thee.

sinaiticus.text: And the officer took him by the hand and withdrew to a private place, and inquired: What is it that thou hast to tell me?

verses.text: And the officer took him by the hand and withdrew to a private place, and inquired: What is it that thou hast to tell me?

sinaiticus.text: And he said: The Jews have agreed to request thee that thou wouldst, on the morrow, bring Paul down into the Sanhedrim, as if thou wouldst inquire somewhat more particularly concerning him.

verses.text: And he said: The Jews have agreed to request thee that thou wouldst, on the morrow, bring Paul down into the Sanhedrim, as if thou wouldst inquire somewhat more particularly concerning him.

sinaiticus.text: Thou therefore be not persuaded by them; for there lie in wait for him more than forty men of them, who have bound themselves by a curse neither to eat nor to drink till they shall have killed him; and now they are ready, awaiting the promise from thee.

verses.text: Thou therefore be not persuaded by them; for there lie in wait for him more than forty men of them, who have bound themselves by a curse neither to eat nor to drink till they shall have killed him; and now they are ready, awaiting the promise from thee.

verses.text: And Paul answered, after the governor had nodded to him to speak: Knowing that thou hast for many years been a judge over this nation, I do readily make a defense for myself.

sinaiticus.text: but had some questions against him concerning their own religion, and concerning a Jesus that had died, who, Paul affirmed, was alive.

verses.text: but had some questions against him concerning their own religion, and concerning a Jesus that had died, who, Paul affirmed, was alive.

sinaiticus.text: But being in doubt with regard to the inquiry concerning these things, I asked if he would go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these.

verses.text: But being in doubt with regard to the inquiry concerning these things, I asked if he would go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these.

sinaiticus.text: And as Paul appealed to be kept for the examination of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I could send him to Caesar.

verses.text: And as Paul appealed to be kept for the examination of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I could send him to Caesar.

sinaiticus.text: And Agrippa said to Festus: I also could wish to hear the man myself. Tomorrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.

verses.text: And Agrippa said to Festus: I also could wish to hear the man myself. Tomorrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.

sinaiticus.text: On the morrow, therefore, when Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and had entered the audience-chamber with the officers and the chief men of the city, and when Festus had commanded, Paul was brought.

verses.text: On the morrow, therefore, when Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and had entered the audience-chamber with the officers and the chief men of the city, and when Festus had commanded, Paul was brought.

sinaiticus.text: And Festus said: King Agrippa, and all men that are present with us, ye see this man concerning whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both in Jerusalem and here, crying out that he ought to live no longer.

verses.text: And Festus said: King Agrippa, and all men that are present with us, ye see this man concerning whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me, both in Jerusalem and here, crying out that he ought to live no longer.

sinaiticus.text: But I perceived that he had done nothing worthy of death, and as this man himself has appealed to Augustus I determined to send him.

verses.text: But I perceived that he had done nothing worthy of death, and as this man himself has appealed to Augustus I determined to send him.

sinaiticus.text: Concerning whom I have nothing certain to write to my Lord; wherefore I have brought him before you and especially before thee,260 King Agrippa, that after the examination has been held, I may have what shall write;

verses.text: Concerning whom I have nothing certain to write to my Lord; wherefore I have brought him before you and especially before thee,260 King Agrippa, that after the examination has been held, I may have what shall write;

sinaiticus.text: for it seems to me unreasonable in sending a prisoner not also to make known the charge against him.

verses.text: for it seems to me unreasonable in sending a prisoner not also to make known the charge against him.

sinaiticus.text: But Agrippa said to Paul: Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth his hand and made his defense.

verses.text: But Agrippa said to Paul: Thou art permitted to speak for thyself. Then Paul stretched forth his hand and made his defense.

sinaiticus.text: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall make a defense this day before thee, concerning all things of which I am accused by the Jews;

verses.text: I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall make a defense this day before thee, concerning all things of which I am accused by the Jews;

sinaiticus.text: especially as thou art acquainted with all the customs and questions that are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.

verses.text: especially as thou art acquainted with all the customs and questions that are among the Jews: wherefore I beseech thee to hear me patiently.

sinaiticus.text: My manner of life, then, from youth, which at the first was among my own nation and in Jerusalem, know all the Jews,

verses.text: My manner of life, then, from youth, which at the first was among my own nation and in Jerusalem, know all the Jews,

sinaiticus.text: who know me from the beginning, if they would testify, that according to the strictest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

verses.text: who know me from the beginning, if they would testify, that according to the strictest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.

sinaiticus.text: And now I stand judged for the hope of the promise made by God to the fathers,

verses.text: And now I stand judged for the hope of the promise made by God to the fathers,

sinaiticus.text: to which hope our twelve tribes, persistently serving night and day, hope to come; concerning which hope, O king, I am accused by the Jews.

verses.text: to which hope our twelve tribes, persistently serving night and day, hope to come; concerning which hope, O king, I am accused by the Jews.

sinaiticus.text: Why is it judged incredible among you that God raises the dead?

verses.text: I then thought with myself that I ought to do many things in opposition to the name of Jesus the Nazarene;

sinaiticus.text: and punishing them often throughout all the synagogues, I compelled them to blaspheme; and being exceedingly mad against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities.

sinaiticus.text: and when we had all fallen to the ground, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew tongue: Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the goads.

verses.text: But I said: Who art thou, Lord? and the Lord said: I am Jesus,

sinaiticus.text: delivering thee from the people and from the Gentiles, to whom now I send thee,

verses.text: delivering thee from the people and from the Gentiles, to whom now I send thee,

sinaiticus.text: to open their eyes, in order to turn them from darkness to light, and from the authority of Satan to God, that they may receive remission of sins, and inheritance among the sanctified by faith that is in me.

verses.text: to open their eyes, in order to turn them from darkness to light, and from the authority of Satan to God, that they may receive remission of sins, and inheritance among the sanctified by faith that is in me.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, king Agrippa, I became not disobedient to the heavenly vision;

verses.text: Wherefore, king Agrippa, I became not disobedient to the heavenly vision;

sinaiticus.text: but, to those in Damascus first, and also to those in Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and to the Gentiles, I announced that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance.

sinaiticus.text: Because of these things, the Jews, having seized me while I was in the temple, attempted to kill me.

verses.text: Because of these things, the Jews, having seized me while I was in the temple, attempted to kill me.

sinaiticus.text: Having therefore obtained help that is from God, up to this day have I stood testifying to both small and great, saying nothing else than the things that the prophets and Moses did say should take place,

verses.text: Having therefore obtained help that is from God, up to this day have I stood testifying to both small and great, saying nothing else than the things that the prophets and Moses did say should take place,

sinaiticus.text: that Christ should suffer, that he first by a resurrection from the dead should show light both to the people and the Gentiles.

verses.text: that Christ should suffer, that he first by a resurrection from the dead should show light both to the people and the Gentiles.

sinaiticus.text: But as he spoke these things in his defense, Festus, with a loud voice, said: Paul, thou art mad: much learning leads thee to madness.

verses.text: But as he spoke these things in his defense, Festus, with a loud voice, said: Paul, thou art mad: much learning leads thee to madness.

sinaiticus.text: But Paul said: I am not mad, most noble Festus, but I utter words of truth and soberness.

verses.text: But Paul said: I am not mad, most noble Festus, but I utter words of truth and soberness.

sinaiticus.text: For the king, before whom I also boldly speak, knows concerning these things; for I am persuaded that none of these things have escaped his notice; for this was not done in a corner.

verses.text: For the king, before whom I also boldly speak, knows concerning these things; for I am persuaded that none of these things have escaped his notice; for this was not done in a corner.

sinaiticus.text: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.

verses.text: King Agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou believest.

sinaiticus.text: But Agrippa said to Paul: With little labor thou persuadest me so as to make me a Christian.

verses.text: But Agrippa said to Paul: With little labor thou persuadest me so as to make me a Christian.

sinaiticus.text: And Paul said: I could pray to God that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, would, both with little and with much labor, become such as I am, except these bonds.

verses.text: And the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and those that sat with them;

verses.text: and having withdrawn, they conversed one with another, saying: This man does nothing worthy of death or of bonds.

verses.text: And embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, that would sail to the places in Asia, we set sail, Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, being with us;

verses.text: And there, the centurion, finding a ship of Alexandria sailing to Italy, put us into it.

sinaiticus.text: But we think worthy to hear from thee what thou thinkest; for concerning this sect we know that it is everywhere spoken against.

verses.text: But we think worthy to hear from thee what thou thinkest; for concerning this sect we know that it is everywhere spoken against.

sinaiticus.text: And having appointed him a day, many came to him at his lodging; to whom, with full testimony, he set forth the kingdom of God, persuading them also concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and the prophets, from morning till evening.

verses.text: And having appointed him a day, many came to him at his lodging; to whom, with full testimony, he set forth the kingdom of God, persuading them also concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and the prophets, from morning till evening.

sinaiticus.text: And some believed the things spoken, and some believed not;

verses.text: And some believed the things spoken, and some believed not;

sinaiticus.text: but not being agreed among themselves, they departed, after Paul had spoken one word: Well did the Holy Spirit speak through Isaiah the prophet to your fathers,

verses.text: but not being agreed among themselves, they departed, after Paul had spoken one word: Well did the Holy Spirit speak through Isaiah the prophet to your fathers,

sinaiticus.text: saying: Go to this people and say: By hearing you shall hear and shall not understand, and seeing you shall see and shall not perceive;

verses.text: saying: Go to this people and say: By hearing you shall hear and shall not understand, and seeing you shall see and shall not perceive;

sinaiticus.text: for the heart of this people has become fat, and with their ears they hear heavily, and their eyes they have closed: lest perhaps they266 should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and turn and I should restore them to health.

verses.text: for the heart of this people has become fat, and with their ears they hear heavily, and their eyes they have closed: lest perhaps they266 should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and turn and I should restore them to health.

sinaiticus.text: Be it known to you, therefore, that to the Gentiles has this salvation of God been sent; and they will hear.

verses.text: Be it known to you, therefore, that to the Gentiles has this salvation of God been sent; and they will hear.

sinaiticus.text: And he dwelt two whole years in his own rented house, and received all that came to him,

verses.text: And he dwelt two whole years in his own rented house, and received all that came to him,

sinaiticus.text: preaching the kingdom of God and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus with all boldness, without hindrance. Acts 29 (From the Sonnini Manuscript)

verses.text: preaching the kingdom of God and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus with all boldness, without hindrance. Acts 29 (From the Sonnini Manuscript)

sinaiticus.text: And Paul, full of the blessings of Christ, and abounding in the spirit, departed out of Rome, determining to go into Spain, for he had a long time proposed to journey thitherward, and was minded also to go from thence to Britain.

verses.text: And Paul, full of the blessings of Christ, and abounding in the spirit, departed out of Rome, determining to go into Spain, for he had a long time proposed to journey thitherward, and was minded also to go from thence to Britain.

sinaiticus.text: For he had heard in Phoenicia that certain of the children of Israel, about the time of the Assyrian captivity, had escaped by sea to ‘the Isles afar off’ as spoken by the Prophet, and called by the Romans Britain.

verses.text: For he had heard in Phoenicia that certain of the children of Israel, about the time of the Assyrian captivity, had escaped by sea to ‘the Isles afar off’ as spoken by the Prophet, and called by the Romans Britain.

sinaiticus.text: And the Lord commanded the gospel to be preached far hence to the Gentiles, and to the lost sheep of the House of Israel.

verses.text: And the Lord commanded the gospel to be preached far hence to the Gentiles, and to the lost sheep of the House of Israel.

sinaiticus.text: And no man hindered Paul: for he testified boldly of Jesus before the tribunes and among the people; and he took with him certain of the brethren which abode with him at Rome, and they took shipping at Ostium and having the winds fair, were brought safely into a haven of Spain.

verses.text: And no man hindered Paul: for he testified boldly of Jesus before the tribunes and among the people; and he took with him certain of the brethren which abode with him at Rome, and they took shipping at Ostium and having the winds fair, were brought safely into a haven of Spain.

sinaiticus.text: And much people were gathered together from the towns and villages, and the hill country; for they had heard of the conversion of the Apostles, and the many miracles which he had wrought.

verses.text: And much people were gathered together from the towns and villages, and the hill country; for they had heard of the conversion of the Apostles, and the many miracles which he had wrought.

sinaiticus.text: And Paul preached mightily in Spain, and great multitudes believed and were converted, for they perceived he was an apostle sent from God.

verses.text: And Paul preached mightily in Spain, and great multitudes believed and were converted, for they perceived he was an apostle sent from God.

sinaiticus.text: And they departed out of Spain, and Paul and his company finding a ship in Armorica sailing unto Britain, they were therein, and passing along the South Coast, they reached a port called Raphinus.

verses.text: And they departed out of Spain, and Paul and his company finding a ship in Armorica sailing unto Britain, they were therein, and passing along the South Coast, they reached a port called Raphinus.

sinaiticus.text: Now when it was voiced abroad that the Apostle had landed on their coast, great multitudes of the inhabitants met him, and they treated Paul courteously and he entered in at the east gate of their city, and lodged in the house of an Hebrew and one of his own nation.

verses.text: Now when it was voiced abroad that the Apostle had landed on their coast, great multitudes of the inhabitants met him, and they treated Paul courteously and he entered in at the east gate of their city, and lodged in the house of an Hebrew and one of his own nation.

sinaiticus.text: And on the morrow he came and stood upon Mount Lud and the people thronged at the gate, and assembled in the Broadway, and he preached Christ unto them, and they believed the Word and

verses.text: And on the morrow he came and stood upon Mount Lud and the people thronged at the gate, and assembled in the Broadway, and he preached Christ unto them, and they believed the Word and

sinaiticus.text: And at even the Holy Ghost fell upon Paul, and he prophesied, saying, Behold, in the last days the God of Peace shall dwell in the cities, and the inhabitants thereof shall be numbered: and in the seventh numbering of the people, their eyes shall be opened, and the glory of their inheritance shine forth before them. The nations shall come up to worship on the mount that testifieth of the patience and long suffering of a servant of the Lord.

verses.text: And at even the Holy Ghost fell upon Paul, and he prophesied, saying, Behold, in the last days the God of Peace shall dwell in the cities, and the inhabitants thereof shall be numbered: and in the seventh numbering of the people, their eyes shall be opened, and the glory of their inheritance shine forth before them. The nations shall come up to worship on the mount that testifieth of the patience and long suffering of a servant of the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: And in the latter-days new tidings of the gospel shall issue forth out of Jerusalem, and the hearts of the people shall rejoice, and behold, fountains shall be opened, and there shall be no more plague.

verses.text: And in the latter-days new tidings of the gospel shall issue forth out of Jerusalem, and the hearts of the people shall rejoice, and behold, fountains shall be opened, and there shall be no more plague.

sinaiticus.text: In those days there shall be wars and rumours of war; and a King shall rise up, and his sword, shall be for the healing of the nations, and His peacemaking shall abide, and the glory of His Kingdom a wonder among princes.

verses.text: In those days there shall be wars and rumours of war; and a King shall rise up, and his sword, shall be for the healing of the nations, and His peacemaking shall abide, and the glory of His Kingdom a wonder among princes.

sinaiticus.text: And it came to pass that certain of the Druids came unto Paul privately, and showed by their rites and ceremonies that they were descended from the Judahites which escaped from bondage in the land of Egypt, and the Apostle believed these things, and he gave them the kiss of peace.

verses.text: And it came to pass that certain of the Druids came unto Paul privately, and showed by their rites and ceremonies that they were descended from the Judahites which escaped from bondage in the land of Egypt, and the Apostle believed these things, and he gave them the kiss of peace.

sinaiticus.text: And Paul abode in his lodgings three months confirming in the faith and preaching Christ continually.

verses.text: And Paul abode in his lodgings three months confirming in the faith and preaching Christ continually.

sinaiticus.text: And after these things, Paul and his brethren departed from Raphinus and sailed unto Atium in Gaul.

verses.text: And after these things, Paul and his brethren departed from Raphinus and sailed unto Atium in Gaul.

sinaiticus.text: And Paul preached in the Roman garrison and among the people, exhorting all men to repent and confess their sins.

verses.text: And Paul preached in the Roman garrison and among the people, exhorting all men to repent and confess their sins.

sinaiticus.text: And there came to him certain of the Belgae to enquire of him of the new doctrine, and of the man Jesus; and Paul opened his heart unto them and told them all things that had befallen him, howbeit that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; and they departed pondering among themselves the things which they had heard.

verses.text: And there came to him certain of the Belgae to enquire of him of the new doctrine, and of the man Jesus; and Paul opened his heart unto them and told them all things that had befallen him, howbeit that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; and they departed pondering among themselves the things which they had heard.

sinaiticus.text: And after much preaching and toil, Paul and his fellow labourers passed into Helvetia, and came to Mount Pontius Pilate, where he who condemned the Lord Jesus dashed himself down headlong, and so miserably perished.

verses.text: And after much preaching and toil, Paul and his fellow labourers passed into Helvetia, and came to Mount Pontius Pilate, where he who condemned the Lord Jesus dashed himself down headlong, and so miserably perished.

sinaiticus.text: And immediately a torrent gushed out of the mountain and washed his body, broken in pieces, into a lake.

verses.text: And immediately a torrent gushed out of the mountain and washed his body, broken in pieces, into a lake.

sinaiticus.text: And Paul stretched forth his hands upon the water, and prayed unto the Lord saying, O Lord God, give a sign unto all nations that here Pontius Pilate which condemned thine only-begotten Son, plunged down headlong into the pit.

verses.text: And Paul stretched forth his hands upon the water, and prayed unto the Lord saying, O Lord God, give a sign unto all nations that here Pontius Pilate which condemned thine only-begotten Son, plunged down headlong into the pit.

sinaiticus.text: And while Paul was yet speaking, behold, there came a great earthquake, and the face of the waters was changed, and the form of the lake like unto the Son of Man hanging in an agony upon the Cross.268

verses.text: And while Paul was yet speaking, behold, there came a great earthquake, and the face of the waters was changed, and the form of the lake like unto the Son of Man hanging in an agony upon the Cross.268

sinaiticus.text: And a voice came out of Heaven saying, Even Pilate hath escaped the wrath to come for he washed his hands before the multitude at the blood shedding of the Lord Jesus.

verses.text: And a voice came out of Heaven saying, Even Pilate hath escaped the wrath to come for he washed his hands before the multitude at the blood shedding of the Lord Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: When, therefore, Paul and those that were with him saw the earthquake, and heard the voice of the angel, they glorified God, and were mightily strengthened in the spirit.

verses.text: When, therefore, Paul and those that were with him saw the earthquake, and heard the voice of the angel, they glorified God, and were mightily strengthened in the spirit.

sinaiticus.text: And they journeyed and came to Mount Julius where stood two pillars, one on the right hand and one on the left hand, erected by Caesar Augustus.

verses.text: And they journeyed and came to Mount Julius where stood two pillars, one on the right hand and one on the left hand, erected by Caesar Augustus.

sinaiticus.text: And Paul, filled with the Holy Ghost, stood up between the two pillars, saying, Men and brethren these stones which ye see this day shall testify of my journey hence; and verily I say, they shall remain until the outpouring of the spirit upon all nations, neither shall the way be hindered throughout all generations.

verses.text: And Paul, filled with the Holy Ghost, stood up between the two pillars, saying, Men and brethren these stones which ye see this day shall testify of my journey hence; and verily I say, they shall remain until the outpouring of the spirit upon all nations, neither shall the way be hindered throughout all generations.

sinaiticus.text: And they went forth and came unto Illtricum, intending to go by Macedonia into Asia, and grace was found in all the churches, and

verses.text: And they went forth and came unto Illtricum, intending to go by Macedonia into Asia, and grace was found in all the churches, and
